alert.note: Alert for Wadena (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 21 at 3:20AM CST until February 23 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM THIS MORNING TO MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches through tonight. For the Winter Storm Watch, blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches possible Wednesday through Thursday. Winds could gust as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Wadena County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 9 AM this morning to midnight CST tonight. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late tonight through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...For the Winter Weather Advisory, be prepared for slick travel conditions. For the Winter Storm Watch, travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Prepare for possible blizzard conditions. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for North Dakota can be found at dot.nd.gov/travel and for Minnesota at 511mn.org, or by calling 5 1 1 in either state.
